question: Hell. And we're going to send them back screaming. Last one to kill a bad guy buys the beer.
answer: The Attack Ship SHOOTS straight up, dodging West's laser BLASTS.

question: What's that sound? must be the fat lady warming up.
answer: The fleeing Attack Ship loops in mid-space, reversing direction, heading straight towards West's Bubble Fighter. A game of chicken.

question: That's right. Come on, come on, you wanna play, I wanna play.
answer: The two ships are ROCKETING towards each other, locked in collision vectors, lasers FIRING wildly. asdasd

question: This whole mission sucks! I Don't want to stay home for dinner. I want to see my friends for the last time. ... On the eve before she is torn from her friends, kidnapped, hurled into deep space against her will, what thoughts fill the mind of the young Space Captive....
answer: Will there be boys on Alpha Centuri? What will I wear?

question: When we wake up in ten years the video journals of Penny Robinson, Space Captive, will be devoured by millions. I will be world famous. You on the other hand, will have been totally forgotten. The Space Captive has decided to wear ribbons of support for fellow sufferers as she is dragged into deep space, green for the ecological issues, white for human rights
answer: You'd probably gag if I described the secondary infections loss of circulation can cause. What are you grinning at?

question: I just found an upside to this mission. The thought of jettisoning your body into deep space.
answer: Dad says Don't bring them. Like anything I do matters to him.

question: He never showed, huh? Don't let him get to you, kiddo. He just gets busy with work is all.
answer: So, that's a no to family dinner?

question: Let's see, do I spend my last night on Earth watching Mom and Dad pretend not to be fighting again or get in ten years of making-out at the mall ... you do the math.
answer: Mom's gonna go thermal.

question: I've got your man. He just doesn't know it yet. At ease, Major.
answer: Sir, why was I pulled off active duty? I salvaged my craft and Jeb's. I'll fight a court martial, General.

question: Do you know Professor Robinson?
answer: By reputation only.

question: How much do you know about the Jupiter Mission, Major?
answer: The Jupiter is fully automated. The pilot flies the ship out of the solar system and lands on Alpha Prime. It's a baby sitting job, sir.

question: Major, you are aware Earth's resources are severely limited.
answer: Every schoolchild knows our recycling technologies will save the environment. Sending a family across the galaxy is a publicity stunt to sell soda to people of all ages.

question: What I am about to tell you is classified. Every schoolchild has been lied to. The recycling technologies have failed. In less than two decades Earth will be unable to support human life. We spun the ad campaign to give the mission a friendly face, keep people from panicking in the streets. We partnered with Coke because the 900 billion this mission cost would have bankrupted the government. The SinoJordanian Alliance knows the truth as well as we do. They hope to reach Alpha Prime first - And if they do, I guarantee you, they will not share the Dimondium with Western Demons like us. our crops will wither. We will be left to die.
answer: ...Captain Daniels doesn't have the flu, does he sir?

question: Daniels was murdered in his apartment last night. The flu story is a cover we fed the press.
answer: Dan was a good pilot. A good man.

question: Your rescue stunt over Mars was foolhardy. Explain yourself, Major.
answer: I had a friend in trouble.

question: You endangered a one billion dollar spacecraft, disobeyed a direct order because of a friend?
answer: Yes sir. And I'd do it again. Sir.

question: He won first prize again. He practically brought down his entire school. But he won first prize.
answer: A non-working prototype for his time machine. Sharp stuff for a midget. I'm sorry about dinner. I had to work late. The new pilot-.

question: What you had to do was prioritize your family over the mission
answer: Maureen. This mission is about our family. So we can stay together

question: The perfect nuclear family. The most stable social unit, ideally suited for the isolation of a long journey into space. It's all just PR, John. You're never home. Judy is becoming a ghost just like you. Penny can't see past her own navel and Will has to black out-his school, just to get his father's attention. The perfect nuclear family in ruin.
answer: I know, Maureen. I'm scared too.

question: You'll forgive me if I forgo the kiss, my sleeping behemoth. But the time has come to awake.
answer: Robot is on-line. Reviewing primary directives. One, preserve the Robinson Family. Two, Maintain ship systems. Three

question: Spare me the chatter. What noble charges my steely centurion. Sadly I fear you have far more dire deeds in store for you.
answer: Robot is on-line. Reviewing primary directives. Two hours into mission destroy Robinson family. Destroy all systems.

question: Don't let me shatter this unbridled display of affection, but we are running behind.
answer: I'll try to give you a smooth ride.

question: Mission control this is Dr. Robinson. We are in the green.
answer: One question, Doctor. in there room in these tubes for two?

question: Barely enough for you and your ego, Major. Drive carefully.
answer: Mission Control, this is Jupiter One. The Robinsons are asleep. We are ready to fly.

question: Mission Control, this is Jupiter One. The Robinsons are asleep. We are ready to fly.
answer: Jupiter Two this is Mission Control. You are at T-minus two minutes and counting. We're opening the dome.

question: External fuel pressure to zero. Powering main drive systems.
answer: Jupiter One you are at ninety five percent.

question: Houston, main drive systems to on line status. It's showtime.
answer: We have lift off.

question: Requesting escape trajectory.
answer: Major, your escape vector in clear of all military and commercial traffic. Op in go on your command.

question: Roger, Houston. We're outta here.
answer: Jupiter One, you are clear Earth's atmosphere.

question: No. Disable program.
answer: Robot is on line. Implementing prime command directives. Robinson family, destroy.

question: No. Cease. Desist.
answer: All operating Systems, destroy. Jupiter Two, destroy. Robinson Family, destroy.

question: Smith, what the hell-
answer: I was making a last minute check ... someone hit me from behind.

question: Sino-Jordanian technology. You're a Goddamned spy.
answer: Stop. What are you doing?

question: We trusted you.
answer: Existence offers us nothing if not the opportunity for an endless series of betrayals.

question: You're a monster.
answer: Perhaps. But I am also the only one who can save your daughter's life.

question: There's got to be some way to get through this.
answer: That's it.

question: What's it?
answer: We can't get away from the sun. So we have to go through it. The hyperdrive -

question: Engage the hyperdrive without a gate, we could be thrown anywhere in the galaxy
answer: Anywhere but here.

question: Judy? Where's Judy?
answer: Boy either I cut down on the coffee or sew in a flap. It's hell getting in and out of this thing.

question: Are you-
answer: Vitals are normal. Pulse and respiration seem to be-

question: Baby, are you okay?
answer: I'm fine Daddy really.

question: I'm hailing on all frequencies. No response.
answer: There are some markings on the starboard side. Can you throw some light on her?

question: Don't know if the exterior spots are working.- There we go. If this in all a dream, why can't there be more girls? I've never seen a design like this. what are those scales on her hull?
answer: How could Earth launch a ship this massive and neither of us know about it? ... It just doesn't make sense.

question: These scanners are damaged, I'm getting inconsistent life signs but they may be sensor ghosts.
answer: Maybe her computer's still up. I'm trying standard remote access codes.

question: These quarters are totally unacceptable. I demand-
answer: We're going to check out the probe ship. Maybe we can figure out how they got here. And how to get home.

question: Ta-ta. Have a wonderful trip.
answer: You're coming with us.

question: Out of the question. I'm a doctor not a space explorer. You and-
answer: What you are is a murderous saboteur and I am not leaving you on this ship so you can do more harm than you've already caused.

question: A ghost ship.
answer: And the flavor of the day is ... banana/beef. Who thinks up these combinations? MM. Good.

question: Major West, I highly recommend you never breed. That by the way is my medical opinion.
answer: Little thing was hungry.

question: With the right command codes, I can light up the probe ship from here. Damn. No response.
answer: Command codes are sequenced. Try the next series.

question: But they won't work until the next fleet of ships are built. That's at least two years away.
answer: Just do it.

question: How did you know?
answer: Think about it, Don. The ships's advanced technology. Your friend looking old. What if that ship is from our future?

question: Get us out of here. Fast. What are you doing?
answer: Never leave an enemy stronghold intact. One of your father's first rules of engagement.

question: Don, stop. That's a direct order. We might need to salvage-
answer: This is a military emergency. That means I'm in command.

question: Don, no. I'm ordering you-
answer: I hate spiders. Hang on, it I a gonna be a bumpy ride.

question: You violated a direct order.
answer: About half the core material is burned out. We'll never generate enough power to break orbit.

question: I told you not to blow that ship's reactors and you did it anyway.
answer: Come on, Professor, give it a rest. I was technically still in command.

question: Don't hand me that. I'm commander of this mission.
answer: Look, no offense, but you're an egghead with an honorary rank. No one ever intended you to handle combat situations. You're spouting some nonsense about- time travel while those spiders posed a continuing threat. I made a judgement call and if I have to I'll make it again. Hell, you of all people should understand that. If your father were here-

question: My father is not here. My father is dead, killed in one of his combat missions you so admire. My family is on this ship And you're going to follow my orders. Whether you agree with them or not. Is that clear, Major?
answer: Save the speeches. I like you. But the fate of the Earth is at stake here. I'm going to do whatever I think it takes to ensure the success of this mission. With or without your help. Is that clear, Professor?

question: Can you hear me? Robot?
answer: Systems error. Robot unable to register neural net outputs. Unable to locate motor controls. Unable-

question: Calm down. Your body was destroyed in the conflict with the space spiders. Do you remember?
answer: Affirmative.

question: But I downloaded your neural net.
answer: Robot tried to destroy the Robinson family. Why would Will Robinson save Robot's personality? Your actions do not compute.

question: I guess sometimes friendship means acting with your heart, not your head.
answer: Logic error. Friendship does not compute.

question: What's the diagnosis, Doc? Is it cowboy or ballerina on Halloween?
answer: Right now she's a girl. But I think your little pal here is from a self-replicating species. At different stages of life she, or he, probably alternates sexes.

question: Imagine the savings on dating outfits alone. Can I keep her?
answer: Penny, you've never taken care of a thing in your life besides yourself.

question: Please. She's all alone. I promise I'll look after her. She needs me.
answer: ...The moment you misplace her, or forget to feed her, we leave her on this planet where she can live in the wild. I'm not kidding Penny.

question: Remove that lock this instant. I shall not be caged like some animal These quarters will be fine. Tell me, Major West. Are you really confident in Robinson's ability to guide us? If I were set free, I would support your right to command. With minimal force, we could take this ship and assure this mission continues under your leadership.
answer: ...My God Smith, you're right. How could I have been so blind? I'll just run and get you a gun so we can hijack the ship. Okay?

question: Sarcasm is the recourse of a weak mind.
answer: I'm hiding the pain. Really.

question: I assure you, Major West. Your pain has just begun.
answer: Star light, star bright...

question: Star light, star bright...
answer: A million strange stars and only one wish. I wish we were home. I never thought a sky could look so alien. ...We really are lost.

question: When the first sailors circled the globe and saw a brand new sky, they thought they had sailed off the edge of the earth. But they were really just around the corner. So those sailors found familiar shapes in the stars to make the skies more friendly, to help them find their way. That's how constellations were born. Porky the wise and mighty Pig.
answer: The great bucktoothed Bunny... Bugs.

question: So, my quarters or yours?
answer: Excuse me?

question: We are the only single man and woman of consenting age in the galaxy. How much more of a set up do you need?
answer: So you figure just dispense with the pleasantries, get down to business?

question: You have a way with words, Doctor. Here would be fine.
answer: Next time, fly slower.

question: What was I thinking, bringing us all out here into space?
answer: The world needed saving. You were the right man for the job.

question: But solving the world's problems doesn't leave much time for the people you love, does it?
answer: Did you get any time with Will?

question: Now he's decided he can rebuild the robot. Wants to show me his designs. I've got too much to do-
answer: Funny creatures, men. You try so hard not to be your fathers, end up making the same mistakes. Will adores you. He needs your attention.

question: We can't get off this planet much less back on course. I don't have time to...
answer: John, just listen to him. it doesn't matter what he's saying. Just listen. Sometimes, at least in the eyes of their fathers, little boys have to come first.

question: As soon as we get back into space, we're going to spend some real time together. I promise. What?
answer: It's nice to have our family under one roof. Even if we had to go half way across the galaxy to manage it.

question: How would you feel about a little late night tutorial, Professor?
answer: Mm. That's new. What are you doing?

question: Going for extra credit.
answer: Good night John.

question: If these portals are opening and closing, part of some cascading, natural phenomenon, they could be tearing this planet apart
answer: These portals are exactly what I predicted my time machine would do. What if the doorways aren't natural? A machine that bends space, like our hyperdrive, could be modified to bend time as well. What if someone on this world has built a device?

question: Son, I appreciate your input but now isn't the time for flights of fancy.
answer: You never listen to me. Not ever.

question: There's no telling how long before this planet breaks up entirely. Aren't you coming out to say goodbye?
answer: You're always leaving. What if... What if one time you don't come home...

question: It sounds like old morse code. You said someone is in danger.
answer: We all are. You are wise to arm yourself.

question: This gun is set to fire for me only so don't try anything funny.
answer: William, you misjudge me. I only want to help you.

question: Help us? You tried to kill us all.
answer: But now our fates are intertwined. if your father and that idiot West fail, I will have no chance of getting home. It is in my best interests they succeed. And I always follow my best interests. What monsters roam these alien wilds? Fools. To set off blindly across this savage land. Much as I hate to admit it, it will be harder to manage without them.

question: What are you talking about? They'll be back. They'll be okay. Someone should go after them.
answer: Will, I forbid it. You're a boy. A clever one, certainly, but a child nonetheless. This planet is likely full of predators. Even if you found them, what if they're hurt, ravaged, dying, what good could you do?

question: I've got a fix on Dad's suit beacon. Wow, that's Mom's favorite color.
answer: How droll. Run, child, run. Will? Will?

question: Wow!
answer: William, wait!

question: See, over here I'm in the future.
answer: I can barely contain my glee. Why aren't you aging like the plants?

question: That's just an effect of the portals forming. Once they stabilize you can cross from one time to another just like stepping between two rooms. What did you find?
answer: Come, come, son, no time for distractions. Let's move on.

question: We should be able to see the ship.
answer: Could these be from the probe?

question: Corroded. This metal is decades old.
answer: It's not possible. What kind of nightmare is this? Where the hell are we?

question: What is this place?
answer: Why Professor, the shock must have scrambled your brain. Look around you. Don't you recognize the spot? You've come home.

question: This can't be... What have you done to the ship. ...Where's my family?
answer: Your family is dead. Dead and in the ground.

question: No!
answer: What fickle consort in memory. Time dims certain images while others shine clear and bright as yesterday. I'll never forget that morning. Twenty years ago. What was it you said? I'll be back. I promise. But I knew better. You never came home. Without you, your family never had a chance. A few spidersv survived the destruction of the probe ship. They reached the planet and attacked. I can still hear the women scream.

question: Who are you?
answer: Don't you recognize me, Dad? It's me. I'm your son. Will.

question: Best as I can tell this whole clan was spawned by this single creature.
answer: Speak, doctor.

question: Each creature seems to have unique corpuscular patterns on their palms. As individual an fingerprints, no two alike. Except...
answer: Except the prints on this giant creature and our little Blip match exactly. Don't they?

question: How did you know?
answer: Because, I think Blip and our friend here are actually one and the same.

question: The doorways in time that led us here must be a side effect of his machine coming on line. Like streams running into the ocean....
answer: Once this core material in fully introduced into the control console, I will open a doorway stable enough for one person to take one trip through time and space as well. Today, I will change history. I will return home, to the very day you took us on this cursed mission. I'll stop us from taking off. I'll do what you never could. I'll save the family. I'll save us all.

question: Look around. Your machine is ripping this planet apart. What if the force wave you ride home has the same effect on Earth? What if, in getting home, you destroy Earth in the process?
answer: I'm going home. I'm going to save the family.

question: Will, I'm your father. You've got to listen to me-.
answer: Let me tell you about my father. My father was a walking ghost. Never there when I needed him. He dragged his family into deep dark space and lost them there. My father is not coming to the rescue.

question: We've got to go inside.
answer: Slow down, now. We can't know what waits inside that ravaged craft. But we can be confidant it is nothing good. And I for one am frightened.

question: But Dad's in there.
answer: Will, listen to me. I have crossed this world with you, found your father as promised. But I can't let you go in there unarmed.

question: But I've got a gun.
answer: If we go forward, the barer of that weapon must be ready to kill. Murder is a skill, one which I have developed and, luckily dear boy, you have not. Look inside your heart, Will. Are you truly capable of taking a life? If not, then I ask you now, put your faith in me. Give me your trust. Give me that gun.

question: Enable gun for all users.
answer: Finally. A brief lesson in survival on this world or any other. Never trust anyone. Remember it into your old age, should you have one.

question: Hurry, boy. Time waits for no man. It's almost time. I really am a word-smith.
answer: Once the core cylinder is fully injected, the planet will begin to come apart and the time doorway will stabilize. Then I jump in.

question: A leap of faith. How fitting.
answer: Tell me again, old monster, how did the girls die?

question: We've been over this before, son. The spiders attacked the ship
answer: In all the years since, the spiders have never re-surfaced. Why?

question: Let's forget the past. What are you doing?
answer: Focusing the aperture. Remember, the energy around the portal will rip a man to pieces.

question: Isn't the doorway too small?
answer: Not for me.

question: Halt or Robot will destroy.
answer: Do you remember what I taught you. A long time ago. About friendship?

question: Friendship means acting with your heart not your head.
answer: That's why I rebuilt you. Because I wanted us to be friends.

question: Logic error. Friendship does not compute.
answer: Forget logic. Act with your heart.

question: Robot has no heart. Robot is powered by a fusion pulse generator
answer: Every living thing has a heart.

question: Any attempts to override command protocols may result in fused processors in my neural net.
answer: Please, Robot, if you don't let us go, we're all going to die. I'm asking you now, will you help us? Will you be my friend?

question: Robot attempting to deactivate control bolt-commands overriddenattempting to reroute-dangercircuitry overloadattempting to escape-kill them, kill them...
answer: You did it.

question: You've got find your way back to the ship. The portals may still be stable. I'll try to meet you there.
answer: What do you mean?

question: I'm going to get that core material. It's our only chance to escape.
answer: I'll stay. The family needs their father

question: The crew needs their pilot. No matter what happens, when the planet starts to break up you take off.
answer: Without the core we'll never have enough power to make orbit.

question: You've got to try. Promise me, Don.
answer: Good luck. Commander.

question: You sabotaged our mission.
answer: Spare me the fury of the righteous. I think there's time for a snack before my trip.

question: You ain't seen nothing yet. Remember the probe ship? These monsters eat their wounded.
answer: No. Stop. No!

question: Come on, son. Wake up.
answer: Dad?

question: I thought I lost you.
answer: The core. You could have taken the core and left before it was too late. You saved me instead.

question: There wasn't any choice. I couldn't let you fall.You're my boy.
answer: Look. They made it.

question: I'm going to try to reach escape velocity. Maybe we can break the gravitational pull.
answer: No. We don't have the core material. The gravity wells will drag us down.

question: We might-
answer: We won't make it. Trust me. I know. We've got to go down.

question: What?
answer: Through the planet as she breaks up.

question: That's insane.
answer: I don't have time to argue. I'm giving you a direct order, Major.
